distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat Ceph Storage 3.3 on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Ceph Storage is a scalable, open, software-defined storage platform that combines the most stable version of the Ceph storage system with a Ceph management platform, deployment utilities, and support services.

Security Fix(es):

* ceph: ListBucket max-keys has no defined limit in the RGW codebase (CVE-2018-16846)

* ceph: debug logging for v4 auth does not sanitize encryption keys (CVE-2018-16889)

* ceph: authenticated user with read only permissions can steal dm-crypt / LUKS key (CVE-2018-14662)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es) and Enhancement(s):

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Ceph Storage 3.3 Release Notes available at:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_ceph_storage/3.3/html/release_notes/index

notes.text: It was found that authenticated ceph user with read only permissions could steal dm-crypt encryption keys used in ceph disk encryption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ceph: authenticated user with read only permissions can steal dm-crypt / LUKS key
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ceph: authenticated user with read only permissions can steal dm-crypt / LUKS key

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way the ListBucket function max-keys has no defined limit in the RGW codebase.  An authenticated ceph RGW user can cause a denial of service attack against OMAPs holding bucked indices.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ceph: ListBucket max-keys has no defined limit in the RGW codebase
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ceph: ListBucket max-keys has no defined limit in the RGW codebase

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: It was found that Ceph RGW did not properly sanitize encryption keys in debug logging for v4 auth. Encryption keys could be inadvertently disclosed when sharing debug logs.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ceph: debug logging for v4 auth does not sanitize encryption keys
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ceph: debug logging for v4 auth does not sanitize encryption keys
